title: Mother is convinced a 'ghost' was sleeping in her baby's crib - but the reality is far simpler
text:
A mother-of-two was terrified to see a 'ghost' lying next to her sleeping child on the baby monitor before the intruder was found to be a print on the mattress.

Maritza Elizabeth, from Illinois, glanced at the screen on Friday night expecting to see her son alone and snuggled up in his blanket.

But instead she saw another child's face smiling back at her in an eerie and ghoulish display that was enough to keep her up all night.

A mother-of-two was terrified to see a 'ghost' lying next to her sleeping child on the baby monitor before the intruder was found to be a print on the mattress (pictured)

'So last night I was positive there was a ghost baby in the bed with my son,' she wrote on Facebook, followed by a picture of the suspected apparition.

'I was so freaked out I barely slept.'

The mother-of-two even tried creeping into her son's bedroom with a flashlight to better understand what was going on.

But the darkness combined with a general fear of waking her son prompted her to leave without too much investigation.

In the morning when she walked in to pick her son up Maritza was startled to find the face still there lying next to him.

'It turns out my husband just forgot to put the mattress protector on when he changed the sheets,' she said.

'I could kill him.'

'It turns out my husband just forgot to put the mattress protector on when he changed the sheets,' she said

The face was nothing more than a print on the bed but from a distance - and in total darkness - it appeared far more sinister.

'I have no prior experience with ghosts. Silly as it seems, I do believe in them though,' Maritza told Kidspot Australia.

'I don't think they're evil and I don't think they're here to hurt people. But just the thought of their presence in my home scares the living daylights out of me.'

Her post about the encounter has gone viral with 470,000 likes alone on Facebook.

Hundreds of other parents found the story extremely relatable and said they'd often thought the baby faces on mattresses were a little bit 'creepy'.
description: An American mother-of-two was terrified to see a 'ghost' lying next to her sleeping child on the baby monitor before the intruder was found to be a print on the mattress.
authors: Matilda Rudd For Daily Mail Australia
